result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Status conference on December 21, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Cash bond is set in the amount of $3,000 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _X_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Nacole G, Shantavia D, or Lisa C. 
- Defendant shall not be at any residence occupied by Lisa C.  
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor.

Court reporter Teri Groves. Defendant Napoleon B Daniel III in court, in custody.  Attorney David Karpe in court for Napoleon B Daniel III.  Attorney Collen Lennon in place of Attorney John D Rice in court for State of Wisconsin. In court for a bail modification filed by the defendant on September 30, 2022. DE's mother with statement. State objects to the bond modification gives argument. Atty Karpe makes argument. Court makes findings and lowers cash bond to $3000 in case 22CF2535. ALL OTHER BOND CONDITIONS REMAIN THE SAME.
Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services

Proceedings: Preliminary Hearing 
Date: October 4, 2022 
Reporter: Claire Stein.
Bail/bond hearing on October 21, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Bail/bond hearing on October 10, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

11:59 AM Defendant Napoleon B Daniel III in court, in custody.  Attorney David Karpe appeared by video for Napoleon B Daniel III.  Prosecuting attorney Tomas Fernando Valerio in court for the State of Wisconsin. Court will send this bail/bond hearing to the branch to address.

Information was E-filed with the court and a copy was given to the defendant; Defendant waived reading of Information; Defendant stood mute, Court enters plea of Not Guilty; motions due in 20 days; bail continued.

11:30 AM Defendant Napoleon B Daniel III in court, in custody.  Attorney David Karpe appeared by video for Napoleon B Daniel III.  Prosecuting attorney Tomas Fernando Valerio in court for the State of Wisconsin. State moved to find counts 1-5 transactionally related.  Court found counts 1-5 transactionally related. Law Enforcement officer Richard Friday duly sworn & testified; Venue Established; Witness ID'd defn; State moves for bindover - waives argument, reserves for rebuttal; Defense objects to bindover - made argument; Ct binds case over; bail continued.

**THIS REQUEST IS APPROVED BY JUDGE FROST**
Atty David Karpe

Cash bond is set in the amount of $5,000 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. 
The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _x_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor. 
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Nacole G, Shantavia D, or Lisa C. 
- Defendant shall not be at any residence occupied by Lisa C. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.

1:35 PM Defendant Napoleon B Daniel III in court, in custody.  Attorney David Karpe in court for Napoleon B Daniel III.  Prosecuting attorney Lillian Rose Nelson in court for the State of Wisconsin. The defendant was advised regarding their right to an attorney and to the SPD application process if not already represented. Defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Defense moved to dismiss Count 1, made argument. Objection by State. Defense withdrew motion.
